intro: Polygala compressa, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family, which includes over 700 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, delicate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white and are clustered in small, racemose inflorescences. Polygala compressa is characterized by its unique seed pods that split open to release its seeds, a feature common among members of its family.
